reviews.text: Lovely railway station, trains are frequent every 15 minutes tops. The platforms make great photos and you can get some good shots of trains. I recommend travelling from this station, and if you are a trainspotter, this is the ideal place for you.

It looked quite nice on arrival, hanging baskets and stuff. We had to collect tickets but the office was boarded up and closed for lunch. We waited until it opened and were told, "use the machine, that's what it's for", whilst he munched on his packed lunch, it really was as friendly and helpful as that.
I think a training course in customer service or just plain common courtesy might be in order. 
Went to the cafe to get some lunch before the train. It was about 1:45, apparently it shuts at 2:00?! so no coffee but we were offered a vegan sausage roll. We didn't bother.....

8 o'clock at night and ticket office still open but toilets locked.Enquired at desk and told, , "I'm going home shortly use the ones on the train" Quite prepared to take money but not provide services..... How surprising.
There's a lovely little cafe at the station with outdoor settling on the platform. A perfect place to sip on a cappuccino and show off my snazzy crocodile shoes.
Some good food and quirky bars.
